summary:
The Security Council,
 
Adopted resolution 1487 (2003) at its 4772nd meeting on 12 June 2003.

Noting the International Criminal Court (ICC) Statute's entry into force on 1 July 2002, 
and that not all States are parties to it, 

The Council requests the ICC not to commence or proceed with investigation or prosecution 
of current or former officials or personnel from a non-State Party to the Rome Statute 
involving UN operations for a 12-month period starting 1 July 2003, 
unless the Security Council decides otherwise, 

consistent with Article 16 of the Rome Statute.

The Council intends to renew this request annually. 

Member States shall take no action inconsistent with this request and their international obligations.

The Council decided to remain seized of the matter.
